Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicolas Armando Arredondo was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Joel David Schlitz DF: Nicolas Armando Arredondo appeared. Case called at 10:32. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads  G to Ct 1 (4th in 5 years) in 15CF51. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF51. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and 3 in 15CF51. Atty's are not requesting a PSI. Court waives PSI. Sentencing arguments. DE has completed his assessment. DE makes statement. Crt orders:

- 6 months St. Croix County Jail
  Credit for 9 days against the sentence.
  Huber for employment, huber for family purposes.
- $1744.00 inclusive of costs
  Apply bond on file
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
- 2 year IID
- 2 year DL revocation
  Credit for administrative suspension.
- AODA and driver's safety plan
DE to meet with the payment clerk. 
DE remanded bond revoked. 
Atty.'s are to check for time served in this county.
Filed by Atty Lundeen. Requesting a continuance of Plea. Hearing reset. km

CO: Commissioner Heckmann; REP: Electronic Tape; Clerk: Liddle ADA:   Megan Kelly supervised by ADA Nieskes DF ATTY:  Barry Curtis Lundeen   DF:  Nicolas Armando Arredondo appeared. Case called at 8:34 a.m. State calls Officer De La Cruz to the stand. S/T Officer Carlos De La Cruz employed with the New Richmond PD. Direct by Megan Kelly. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. PBT .151. State's Exhibit #1(certified driving record). Atty Lundeen does not object to purposes of this hearing. Court O/R Exhibit #1. Cross by Atty Lundeen. Witness excused at 8:54 a.m. States asks that court find probable cause. Court finds probable cause that felony has been commited and binds defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:45 am.
